title: Eater of Worlds
summaries: The Eater of Worlds is a pre-Hardmode Corruption-themed worm boss. It is summoned using Worm Food from within The Corruption or Underground Corruption, or by destroying 3 Shadow Orbs that spawn in Corruption worlds. It can be summoned at any time of day.

The Eater of Worlds is not a single target, but a string of segments with individual health. On the <linked>[img:Desktop version]</linked><linked> Desktop</linked>, <linked>[img:Console version]</linked><linked> Console</linked>, and <linked>[img:Mobile version]</linked><linked> Mobile</linked> versions, it has a total of 67 / <linked>72</linked> segments, whereas on the <linked>[img:Old-gen console version]</linked><linked> Old-gen console</linked> and <linked>3DS</linked><linked>[img:Nintendo 3DS version]</linked> versions, it has a total of 50 segments. When any inner body segment is destroyed, it splits into multiple smaller worms, each with their own head and tail. Each section of the Eater must be killed in order to defeat the entire boss. The Eater of Worlds, like all worms, is immune to <linked>lava</linked>.

Fighting the Eater of Worlds is the only way to obtain Shadow Scales, and it is one of the only ways to obtain usable quantities of Demonite Ore. Individual segments drop some of these when killed, with a larger amount of them being dropped upon defeating the entire boss. Defeating the Eater of Worlds for the first time allows the spawning of the Tavernkeep(Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) NPC (as the Unconscious Man), (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) and allows meteorites to land.

The Eater of Worlds is the Corruption <linked>counterpart</linked> to <linked>the Crimson</linked>'s <linked>Brain of Cthulhu</linked>. The <linked>Hardmode</linked> <linked>mechanical boss</linked> equivalent to the Eater of Worlds is <linked>The Destroyer</linked>.
While the Eater of Worlds is alive, the music Boss 1 will play. When Otherworldly music (Desktop, Console and Mobile versions) is enabled, the track Boss 1 (Otherworldly) will play instead.
